opendial.inference

Class SwitchingAlgorithm

  • java.lang.Object
    • opendial.inference.SwitchingAlgorithm
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    InferenceAlgorithm

    public class SwitchingAlgorithm
extends java.lang.Object
implements InferenceAlgorithm
    Switching algorithms that alternative between an exact algorithm (variable elimination) and an approximate algorithm (likelihood weighting) depending on the query.

    The switching mechanism is defined via three thresholds:

    • one threshold on the maximum branching factor of the network
    • one threshold on the maximum number of query variables
    • one threshold on the maximum number of continuous variables

    If at least one of these thresholds is exceeded, the selected algorithm will be likelihood weighting. Variable elimination is selected in the remaining cases.

    Version:
    $Date:: 2014-03-20 20:28:23 #$
    Author:
    Pierre Lison (plison@ifi.uio.no)

      • reduce

        public BNetwork reduce(ReductionQuery query)
                throws DialException
        Reduces a Bayesian network to a subset of variables. The method is divided in three steps:
        • The method first checks whether inference is necessary at all or whether the current network can be returned as it is.
        • If inference is necessary, the algorithm divides the network into cliques and performs inference on each clique separately.
        • Finally, if only one clique is present, the reduction selects the best algorithm and return the result of the reduction process.
        Specified by:
        reduce in interface InferenceAlgorithm
        Parameters:
        query - the reduction query
        Returns:
        the reduced network
        Throws:
        DialException

        public InferenceAlgorithm selectBestAlgorithm(Query query)
